intro: Cunila longiflora, commonly known as long-flowered cunila, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland areas and has finely divided leaves that resemble those of other umbelliferous species. It is often found in the eastern United States and is known for its aromatic properties. Cunila longiflora is also valued for its potential medicinal uses, though it is less commonly cultivated than other members of its family.
